abstract: Farmers in California's Sacramento and San Joaquin river delta are offering to voluntarily cut their water use by 25 percent in exchange for no additional cutbacks in future; offer, if accepted, will mark first deal of its kind in state where farmers have long considered water supply guaranteed.
lead_paragraph: Growers in California’s Sacramento and San Joaquin river delta said they would give up a quarter of their water if California promised not to make further cutbacks.

headline.main: California Farmers Offer Concession in Drought
headline.print_headline: Farmers Offer a Concession in Exchange for a Promise

snippet: Growers in California’s Sacramento and San Joaquin river delta said they would give up a quarter of their water if California promised not to make further cutbacks.
